newsitem.title: SPAIN: NATO states move closer to agreement at summit.
newsitem.headline: NATO states move closer to agreement at summit.

text.p: NATO states are close to agreement on inviting just three former communist states -- Poland, Hungary and the Czech Republic -- to join the alliance, NATO officials attending a summit in Madrid said on Tuesday.

Senior alliance diplomats had made "considerable progress" on the issue at a meeting which lasted until the early hours of Tuesday in return for strong language committing the alliance to leave the door open for later enlargements, they said.

The issue had split the 16-member alliance with France, Italy and other European members pressing for Romania and Slovenia to be included in the first round, and the United States insisting on only the three frontrunners.
"There is an emerging consensus on three in return for a statement on the 'open door', and strong support for firm language on that 'open door'," one official told reporters.
"The two are part of the same package and I am confident we will be getting there later today."
He said there was, however, no agreement on whether to specifically name countries, such as Romania and Slovenia, which just failed to make the grade on this occasion.

He said that following a meeting of top alliance diplomats foreign ministers would be sent to try to narrow down differences on the communique in a room next to the one where NATO leaders were meeting later on Tuesday.
